p: In vitro tests of OFIEOH demonstrated the potential of the plant as a natural antiparasitic, although the tests were performed with the total extract and thus, it would be difficult to attribute any parasite control effect to a class or component of the described phytochemicals. However, analyzing the composition of the extract, we verified that the antiparasitic effects may be due to the large fraction of phenolic compounds and more specifically the quercetin derivative. In contrast, reference [ 11] used the EHT and LMT in the partitioned extracts from cladodes and found a higher efficacy, probably from the tannin-rich components.
